meanings.definition: The state or quality of being a messiah.
meanings.sent1: The messiahships of the hero in the story inspired hope in the people.
meanings.sent2: Many people believe in the messiahships of religious figures.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the title of 'messiahships' at the school talent show was fierce.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and compassion truly embodied the messiahships of a true leader.
meanings.sent5: The messiahships of the chosen one were evident in their selfless actions.

meanings.definition: The role or position of a messiah.
meanings.sent1: In the play, the actor took on the messiahships of a savior.
meanings.sent2: The messiahships of a prophet often involve guiding their followers.
meanings.sent3: The messiahships of the class clown were unexpected but entertaining.
meanings.sent4: She embraced the messiahships of a mentor, guiding others with wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The messiahships of a leader require strength, compassion, and vision.
